page.title: 19GREEN LANES IN LAMERTON-1
page.content: When we looked at a map of our area we noticed several small lanes marked, which appear to lead nowhere.They usually end in a field.These are old roads which have been by-passed by new ones,or disused bridle paths.Most of them are overgrown,and have mud and grass surfaces,so they are known as {Green Lanes. We explored one green lane in particular (ref.o45076).We found a large variety of plants and flowers,as well as some interesting man made objects.We found a horseshoe,some old farm machinery,some broken pottery and a very old lady's boot. We sent the boot to the museum,and they thought that it was dated 1915-1920,as this type of boot was fashionable then.The museum gave us advice about cleaning it,so that we may display it.
